reviewText: It was so much more than I expected. My family enjoyed it and my husband was so surprised when he saw that I was in it!!!!!!

I completed the HST's first two deployments, and the video gives a very good overview of the building of a Nimitz Class Aircraft carrier. The only complaint that I have is that the producers could have done an overview of each the departments on the HST to give the viewers a better idea of what Sailors do on these floating cities.

Roy Schieder competently narrates this behind the scenes look at the construction and initial at-sea operational tests of the modern aircraft carrier.  Witness the liberal application of elbow grease by the blue collar men and women of Newport News, Virginia as they manufacture and assemble the last Nimitz class carriers of the 20th century: the USS Harry S. Truman (CVN-75) and the USS Ronald Reagan (CVN-76).
